column4: I'm having sound problems on an IMAC running natty.  Can anyone help or direct me to a better room to seek help?
yes: the headphone jack doesnt seem to be recognized
the other dimension of the problem is that in trying to fix it last month I changed the naming of the computer in I don't know what file
open both for editing using sudo and then change both files,
which two files  in BOTH /etc/hosts and /etc/hostname ?
yes, change both if you want to change hostname of a system. If you change one then try to run sudo, it will fail and you will need to drop to root recovery mode to edit the other
it's not the hostname that is the problem
ok what make and model is the systtem (if you have one)
24 inch IMAC 2.8 Ghz dual core, running natty
what is the output of: wget -O alsa-info.sh http://alsa-project.org/alsa-info.sh && bash ./alsa-info.sh

try adding: options snd-hda-intel model=mbp55    to /etc/modprobe.d/alsa-base.conf    you appear to have options snd-hda-intel model=asus-a7m  and options snd-hda-intel model=macpro  currently which is weird
yes, just commant out the current texts so you can roll back easily
Thanks for your help the other day with my sound problem: all is well now
what video chip are you using?
